## Description {#details}

Information about the backedge-taken count of a loop.

This currently includes an exact count and a maximum count.

Definition at line 1522 of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/analysis/scalarevolution-h">ScalarEvolution.h</a>.

### getExact() {#ad1b74acfc9677a0e14dbaf697508977c}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>const SCEV &#42; ScalarEvolution::BackedgeTakenInfo::getExact (<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/loop">Loop</a> &#42; L, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scalarevolution">ScalarEvolution</a> &#42; SE, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/smallvectorimpl">SmallVectorImpl</a>&lt; <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scevpredicate">SCEVPredicate</a> &#42; &gt; &#42; Preds=nullptr) const</>}>
Return an expression indicating the exact <em>backedge-taken</em> count of the loop if it is known or <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/scevcouldnotcompute">SCEVCouldNotCompute</a> otherwise.

Get the exact loop backedge taken count considering all loop exits.

If execution makes it to the backedge on every iteration (i.e. there are no abnormal exists like exception throws and thread exits) then this is the number of times the loop header will execute minus one.

If the <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scev">SCEV</a> predicate associated with the answer can be different from AlwaysTrue, we must add a (non null) Predicates argument. The <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scev">SCEV</a> predicate associated with the answer will be added to Predicates. A run-time check needs to be emitted for the <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scev">SCEV</a> predicate in order for the answer to be valid.

Note that we should always know if we need to pass a predicate argument or not from the way the ExitCounts vector was computed. If we allowed <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scev">SCEV</a> predicates to be generated when populating this vector, this information can contain them and therefore a <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scevpredicate">SCEVPredicate</a> argument should be added to getExact.

A computable result can only be returned for loops with all exiting blocks dominating the latch. howFarToZero assumes that the limit of each loop test is never skipped. This is a valid assumption as long as the loop exits via that test. For precise results, it is the caller&#39;s responsibility to specify the relevant loop exiting block using getExact(ExitingBlock, SE).

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/analysis/scalarevolution-h/#l01591">1591</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/analysis/scalarevolution-h">ScalarEvolution.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/analysis/scalarevolution-cpp/#l08637">8637</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/analysis/scalarevolution-cpp">ScalarEvolution.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### getExact() {#a607b9d70ff01e2113b3e4e5482b82f76}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>const SCEV &#42; llvm::ScalarEvolution::BackedgeTakenInfo::getExact (<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/basicblock">BasicBlock</a> &#42; ExitingBlock, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scalarevolution">ScalarEvolution</a> &#42; SE, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/smallvectorimpl">SmallVectorImpl</a>&lt; <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scevpredicate">SCEVPredicate</a> &#42; &gt; &#42; Predicates=nullptr) const</>}
  labels = {["inline"]}>
Return the number of times this loop exit may fall through to the back edge, or <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/scevcouldnotcompute">SCEVCouldNotCompute</a>.

The loop is guaranteed not to exit via this block before this number of iterations, but may exit via another block. If <code>Predicates</code> is null the function returns CouldNotCompute if predicates are required, otherwise it fills in the required predicates.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/analysis/scalarevolution-h/#l01600">1600</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/analysis/scalarevolution-h">ScalarEvolution.h</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### getSymbolicMax() {#a3a71a0c9727aaf780b0e33422a91f55e}

## Private Member Attributes

### ConstantMax {#a9e552bdaca2141a6b97a546fff6ea849}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>const SCEV&#42; llvm::ScalarEvolution::BackedgeTakenInfo::ConstantMax = nullptr</>}>
<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/expression">Expression</a> indicating the least constant maximum backedge-taken count of the loop that is known, or a <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/scevcouldnotcompute">SCEVCouldNotCompute</a>.

This expression is only valid if the predicates associated with all loop exits are true.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/analysis/scalarevolution-h/#l01532">1532</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/analysis/scalarevolution-h">ScalarEvolution.h</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### ExitNotTaken {#a89955eff8ff8bc5687b278f566fe8b75}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>SmallVector&lt;ExitNotTakenInfo, 1&gt; llvm::ScalarEvolution::BackedgeTakenInfo::ExitNotTaken</>}>
A list of computable exits and their not-taken counts.

Loops almost never have more than one computable exit.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/analysis/scalarevolution-h/#l01527">1527</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/analysis/scalarevolution-h">ScalarEvolution.h</a>.
